requirement.description: The web application should handle user input in the height input field with data-testid 'height-input' as follows: When the user enters a valid numeric value, including edge cases such as '0' and very large numbers like '999999999', the system must display this value in the height output section with data-testid 'height-output'. Additionally, the output row with data-testid 'output-row' and the reset button with data-testid 'reset-button' should become visible. If the user enters a non-numeric value, the height output section should not display the invalid input, and the visibility of the output row and reset button should remain unchanged.

test_case:

    And the output row with data-testid "output-row" should be visible

requirement.description: When the user interacts with the first dropdown (data-testid='first-option-select'), the system should dynamically update the input field's (data-testid='height-input') placeholder to reflect the selected unit. The placeholder should change to 'Enter [Selected Unit]...' where [Selected Unit] is the unit chosen by the user. Additionally, the height name section (data-testid='height-name') should display '[Selected Unit]:' to indicate the current unit of measurement. If the user selects the default option 'Select an Option', the input field should retain its original placeholder 'Enter Height...', and the height name section should remain empty. This ensures that the UI accurately reflects the user's selection and provides clear guidance on the expected input format.

test_case:
Feature: Update input field placeholder and height name based on the first dropdown selection

  As a user,
  I want the input field"s placeholder and height name section to update dynamically
  So that I can see the selected unit reflected in the UI.


  Scenario: [Normal] Update placeholder and height name when a valid unit is selected from the first dropdown
    Given the webpage is loaded and the first dropdown with data-testid "first-option-select" is visible
    When the user selects "Centimeters" from the first dropdown
    Then the input field with data-testid "height-input" should have the placeholder "Enter Centimeters..."
    And the height name section with data-testid "height-name" should display "Centimeters:"
test_cases.step_code:
from behave import given, when, then
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait
from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC
import time

file_path = "/Users/lingyao/PycharmProjects/E2ESD_data_construct/data/Ourdatas/LJY_TEST_NEW2/E2ESD_Bench_13/index.html"

@given('the webpage is loaded and the first dropdown with data-testid "first-option-select" is visible')
def step_given_webpage_loaded(context):
    context.driver = webdriver.Chrome()
    context.driver.get(f"file:///Users/lingyao/PycharmProjects/E2ESD_data_construct/data/Ourdatas/LJY_TEST_NEW2/E2ESD_Bench_13/index.html")
    WebDriverWait(context.driver, 10).until(
        EC.visibility_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='first-option-select']"))
    )
    time.sleep(1)

@when('the user selects "Centimeters" from the first dropdown')
def step_when_select_centimeters(context):
    first_dropdown = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='first-option-select']")
    first_dropdown.click()
    time.sleep(1)
    centimeters_option = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='first-option-select-centimeters']")
    centimeters_option.click()
    time.sleep(1)

@then('the input field with data-testid "height-input" should have the placeholder "Enter Centimeters..."')
def step_then_check_placeholder(context):
    height_input = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='height-input']")
    placeholder_text = height_input.get_attribute("placeholder")
    assert placeholder_text == "Enter Centimeters...", f"Expected placeholder 'Enter Centimeters...', but got '{placeholder_text}'"
    time.sleep(1)

@then('the height name section with data-testid "height-name" should display "Centimeters:"')
def step_then_check_height_name(context):
    height_name = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='height-name']")
    height_name_text = height_name.text
    assert height_name_text == "Centimeters:", f"Expected height name 'Centimeters:', but got '{height_name_text}'"
    time.sleep(1)

def after_scenario(context, scenario):
    context.driver.quit()

test_cases.step_code:
from behave import given, when, then
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait
from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC
import time

file_path = "/Users/lingyao/PycharmProjects/E2ESD_data_construct/data/Ourdatas/LJY_TEST_NEW2/E2ESD_Bench_13/index.html"

@given('the webpage is loaded and the first dropdown with data-testid "first-option-select" is visible')
def step_given_webpage_loaded(context):
    # Initialize the WebDriver
    context.driver = webdriver.Chrome()
    context.driver.get(f"file:///Users/lingyao/PycharmProjects/E2ESD_data_construct/data/Ourdatas/LJY_TEST_NEW2/E2ESD_Bench_13/index.html")
    context.driver.maximize_window()

    # Wait for the first dropdown to be visible
    WebDriverWait(context.driver, 10).until(
        EC.visibility_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='first-option-select']"))
    )
    time.sleep(1)  # Add a short delay for robustness

@when('the user selects the default option "Select an Option" from the first dropdown')
def step_when_user_selects_default_option(context):
    # Locate the first dropdown and select the default option
    first_dropdown = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='first-option-select']")
    WebDriverWait(context.driver, 10).until(EC.element_to_be_clickable((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='first-option-select']")))
    first_dropdown.click()

    # Select the default option
    default_option = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='first-option-select-default']")
    default_option.click()
    time.sleep(1)  # Add a short delay for robustness

@then('the input field with data-testid "height-input" should retain its placeholder "Enter Height..."')
def step_then_input_field_placeholder(context):
    # Locate the input field and verify its placeholder
    input_field = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='height-input']")
    placeholder = input_field.get_attribute("placeholder")
    assert placeholder == "Enter Height...", f"Expected placeholder 'Enter Height...', but got '{placeholder}'"
    time.sleep(1)  # Add a short delay for robustness

@then('the height name section with data-testid "height-name" should remain empty')
def step_then_height_name_empty(context):
    # Locate the height name section and verify it is empty
    height_name_section = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='height-name']")
    height_name_text = height_name_section.text.strip()
    assert height_name_text == "", f"Expected height name section to be empty, but got '{height_name_text}'"
    time.sleep(1)  # Add a short delay for robustness

# Cleanup after tests
def after_scenario(context, scenario):
    if hasattr(context, 'driver'):
        context.driver.quit()

test_cases.step_code:
from behave import given, when, then
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait
from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC
import time

file_path = "/Users/lingyao/PycharmProjects/E2ESD_data_construct/data/Ourdatas/LJY_TEST_NEW2/E2ESD_Bench_13/index.html"

@given('the webpage is loaded and the first dropdown with data-testid "first-option-select" is visible')
def step_given_webpage_loaded(context):
    # Initialize the WebDriver
    context.driver = webdriver.Chrome()
    # Load the test page
    context.driver.get(f"file:///Users/lingyao/PycharmProjects/E2ESD_data_construct/data/Ourdatas/LJY_TEST_NEW2/E2ESD_Bench_13/index.html")
    # Wait for the first dropdown to be visible
    WebDriverWait(context.driver, 10).until(
        EC.visibility_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='first-option-select']"))
    )
    time.sleep(1)  # Allow the page to stabilize

@when('the user does not select any option from the first dropdown')
def step_when_no_option_selected(context):
    # Ensure no option is selected (default state)
    first_dropdown = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='first-option-select']")
    selected_option = first_dropdown.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='first-option-select-default']")
    assert selected_option.is_selected(), "Default option should be selected"
    time.sleep(1)

@then('the input field with data-testid "height-input" should retain its placeholder "Enter Height..."')
def step_then_placeholder_retains(context):
    # Verify the placeholder text of the input field
    height_input = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='height-input']")
    placeholder_text = height_input.get_attribute("placeholder")
    assert placeholder_text == "Enter Height...", f"Expected placeholder to be 'Enter Height...', but got '{placeholder_text}'"
    time.sleep(1)

@then('the height name section with data-testid "height-name" should remain empty')
def step_then_height_name_empty(context):
    # Verify the height name section is empty
    height_name = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='height-name']")
    height_name_text = height_name.text.strip()
    assert height_name_text == "", f"Expected height name section to be empty, but got '{height_name_text}'"
    time.sleep(1)

# Teardown to close the browser after the test
def after_scenario(context, scenario):
    if hasattr(context, 'driver'):
        context.driver.quit()

requirement.description: When the user interacts with the Height Convertor web application, the system should dynamically update the UI based on user selections. Specifically, when the user selects a unit from the second dropdown (located in the DOM with data-testid 'second-option-select'), the system must display the selected unit name in the converted height name section (located in the DOM with data-testid 'converted-height-name'). This update should occur immediately upon selection. The system should handle all valid unit selections, including 'Miles', 'Centimeters', 'Meters', 'Kilometers', and 'Inches'. If the user selects the same unit in both dropdowns, the system should still display the unit name in the converted height name section, but the conversion result should remain unchanged. The system should ensure that the converted height name section is visible and correctly reflects the user's selection.

3.concise_requirement: When the user selects a unit from the second dropdown, the system should display the selected unit name in the converted height name section.

test_case:
Feature: Display Selected Unit Name in Converted Height Name Section
  The system should display the selected unit name in the converted height name section when the user selects a unit from the second dropdown.


Scenario: [Normal] User selects a valid unit from the second dropdown
    Given the Height Convertor page is loaded
    And the user has selected "Miles" from the first dropdown with data-testid "first-option-select"
    When the user selects "Centimeters" from the second dropdown with data-testid "second-option-select"
    Then the converted height name section with data-testid "converted-height-name" should display "Centimeters:"

requirement.description:
The Height Convertor web application must allow users to convert height values between different units of measurement. The application should include the following functionalities: 

1. **UI Elements and Interactions:**
   - A height input field with `data-testid='height-input'` where users can enter a numeric value representing the height they wish to convert.
   - A dropdown menu with `data-testid='first-option-select'` for selecting the initial unit of measurement. Options include 'Centimeters', 'Inches', 'Meters', 'Kilometers', and 'Miles'.
   - A second dropdown menu with `data-testid='second-option-select'` for selecting the target unit of measurement. Options include 'Centimeters', 'Inches', 'Meters', 'Kilometers', and 'Miles'.
   - A final output section with `data-testid='final-output'` where the converted height value will be displayed.
   - A reset button with `data-testid='reset-button'` to clear all inputs and outputs.

2. **Functional Requirements:**
   - When a user enters a height value in the input field, the system should immediately display this value in the output section with `data-testid='height-output'` and make the output row visible.
   - Upon selecting a unit from the first dropdown, the placeholder text of the height input field should update to reflect the selected unit, and the label with `data-testid='height-name'` should display the selected unit.
   - Upon selecting a unit from the second dropdown, the label with `data-testid='converted-height-name'` should display the selected unit.
   - The system should perform the conversion based on the selected units and display the result in the final output section. Conversion formulas should be applied as follows:
     - Miles to Centimeters: multiply by 160934
     - Miles to Kilometers: multiply by 1.60934
     - Miles to Meters: multiply by 1609.34
     - Miles to Inches: multiply by 63360
     - Centimeters to Miles: divide by 160934
     - Centimeters to Kilometers: divide by 100000
     - Centimeters to Meters: multiply by 0.01
     - Centimeters to Inches: multiply by 0.3937
     - Kilometers to Centimeters: multiply by 100000
     - Kilometers to Miles: divide by 1.609
     - Kilometers to Meters: multiply by 1000
     - Kilometers to Inches: multiply by 39370
     - Meters to Miles: divide by 1609
     - Meters to Kilometers: divide by 1000
     - Meters to Centimeters: multiply by 100
     - Meters to Inches: multiply by 39.37
     - Inches to Miles: divide by 63360
     - Inches to Kilometers: divide by 39370
     - Inches to Meters: divide by 39.37
     - Inches to Centimeters: multiply by 2.54
   - If the same unit is selected in both dropdowns, the system should display the original height value in the final output section.
   - The reset button should clear all inputs and outputs, hiding the output row and reset button itself.

3. **Edge Cases and Error Handling:**
   - If the user enters '0' as the height value, the system should correctly handle the conversion and display '0' in the final output.
   - If no units are selected from the dropdowns, the system should display the original height value in the final output without performing any conversion.
   - The system should handle large values, such as converting '10000' kilometers to miles, and display the result accurately in the final output.

4.concise_requirement: When both units are selected and a height value is entered, the system should convert the height from the first unit to the second unit and display the result in the final output section.

test_case:
Feature: Height Conversion Functionality
  The system should convert the height from the first unit to the second unit and display the result in the final output section when both units are selected and a height value is entered.


  Scenario: [Normal] Convert height from Miles to Kilometers
    Given the Height Convertor page is loaded
    And the user enters "5" into the height input field with data-testid "height-input"
    And the user selects option with data-testid "first-option-select-miles" from the first unit dropdown with data-testid "first-option-select"
    And the user selects option with data-testid "second-option-select-kilometers" from the second unit dropdown with data-testid "second-option-select"
    When the height is converted
    Then the final output with data-testid "final-output" should display "8.0467"
test_cases.step_code:
from behave import given, when, then
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait
from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC
import time

file_path = "/Users/lingyao/PycharmProjects/E2ESD_data_construct/data/Ourdatas/LJY_TEST_NEW2/E2ESD_Bench_13/index.html"

@given('the Height Convertor page is loaded')
def step_impl(context):
    # Initialize the WebDriver and load the test page
    context.driver = webdriver.Chrome()
    context.driver.get(f"file://{file_path}")
    context.driver.maximize_window()
    time.sleep(1)  # Allow the page to fully load

@given('the user enters "{height}" into the height input field with data-testid "height-input"')
def step_impl(context, height):
    # Locate the height input field and enter the specified height
    height_input = WebDriverWait(context.driver, 10).until(
        EC.presence_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='height-input']"))
    )
    height_input.clear()
    height_input.send_keys(height)
    time.sleep(1)

@given('the user selects option with data-testid "first-option-select-miles" from the first unit dropdown with data-testid "first-option-select"')
def step_impl(context):
    # Locate the first dropdown and select the specified unit
    first_dropdown = WebDriverWait(context.driver, 10).until(
        EC.presence_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='first-option-select']"))
    )
    first_dropdown.click()
    time.sleep(1)
    option = WebDriverWait(context.driver, 10).until(
        EC.presence_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='first-option-select-miles']"))
    )
    option.click()
    time.sleep(1)

@given('the user selects option with data-testid "second-option-select-kilometers" from the second unit dropdown with data-testid "second-option-select"')
def step_impl(context):
    # Locate the second dropdown and select the specified unit
    second_dropdown = WebDriverWait(context.driver, 10).until(
        EC.presence_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='second-option-select']"))
    )
    second_dropdown.click()
    time.sleep(1)
    option = WebDriverWait(context.driver, 10).until(
        EC.presence_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='second-option-select-kilometers']"))
    )
    option.click()
    time.sleep(1)

@when('the height is converted')
def step_impl(context):
    # Wait for the output row to become visible, indicating the conversion is complete
    WebDriverWait(context.driver, 10).until(
        EC.visibility_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='output-row']"))
    )
    time.sleep(1)

@then('the final output with data-testid "final-output" should display "{expected_output}"')
def step_impl(context, expected_output):
    # Locate the final output element and verify its text matches the expected output
    final_output = WebDriverWait(context.driver, 10).until(
        EC.presence_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='final-output']"))
    )
    actual_output = final_output.text.strip()
    assert expected_output == actual_output, f"Expected '{expected_output}', but got '{actual_output}'"

    # Close the browser after the test
    context.driver.quit()

Feature: Height Conversion Functionality
  The system should convert the height from the first unit to the second unit and display the result in the final output section when both units are selected and a height value is entered.


  Scenario: [Edge] Convert height from Kilometers to Miles with a large value
    Given the Height Convertor page is loaded
    And the user enters "10000" into the height input field with data-testid "height-input"
    And the user selects "Kilometers" from the first unit dropdown with data-testid "first-option-select"
    And the user selects "Miles" from the second unit dropdown with data-testid "second-option-select"
    When the height is converted
    Then the final output with data-testid "final-output" should display "6213.71"

requirement.description: When the user clicks the reset button with data-testid 'reset-button', the system should perform the following actions: clear the height input field with data-testid 'height-input', reset the first option select with data-testid 'first-option-select' to display 'Select an Option', reset the second option select with data-testid 'second-option-select' to display 'Select', hide the output row with data-testid 'output-row', and hide the reset button itself. This functionality should work regardless of whether the user has entered valid, invalid, or no input prior to clicking the reset button.
related_elements: ("By.CSS_SELECTOR", "height-input", "Input field for the user's height (validation check)
("By.CSS_SELECTOR", "output-row", "Row displaying the output, which should be hidden (validation check)
(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='first-option-select']", "Dropdown for selecting the first unit option")
(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='second-option-select-centimeters']", "Option for selecting 'Centimeters' in the second unit dropdown")
("By.CSS_SELECTOR", "second-option-select", "Dropdown for selecting the second option (validation check)
(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='second-option-select']", "Dropdown for selecting the second unit option")
("By.CSS_SELECTOR", "output-row", "Row displaying the output, which should be hidden")
(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='first-option-select-miles']", "Option for selecting 'Miles' in the first unit dropdown")
("By.CSS_SELECTOR", "first-option-select", "Dropdown for selecting the first option (validation check)

5.concise_requirement: When the user clicks the reset button, the system should clear all inputs and outputs, reset the form, and hide the output row and reset button.

test_case:
Feature: Reset Functionality
  The system should clear all inputs and outputs, reset the form, and hide the output row and reset button when the user clicks the reset button.


  Scenario: [Normal] Reset button clears inputs and outputs
    Given the webpage "Height Convertor" is loaded
    And the user enters "150" into the height input field with data-testid "height-input"
    And the user selects "Centimeters" from the first option select with data-testid "first-option-select"
    And the user selects "Meters" from the second option select with data-testid "second-option-select"
    When the user clicks the reset button with data-testid "reset-button"
    Then the height input field with data-testid "height-input" should be empty
    And the output row with data-testid "output-row" should be hidden
    And the reset button with data-testid "reset-button" should be hidden

Feature: Reset Functionality
  The system should clear all inputs and outputs, reset the form, and hide the output row and reset button when the user clicks the reset button.


  Scenario: [Edge] Reset button with no prior input
    Given the webpage "Height Convertor" is loaded
    When the user clicks the reset button with data-testid "reset-button"
    Then the height input field with data-testid "height-input" should be empty
    And the first option select with data-testid "first-option-select" should display "Select an Option"
    And the second option select with data-testid "second-option-select" should display "Select"
    And the output row with data-testid "output-row" should be hidden
    And the reset button with data-testid "reset-button" should be hidden

Feature: Reset Functionality
  The system should clear all inputs and outputs, reset the form, and hide the output row and reset button when the user clicks the reset button.


Scenario: [Error] Reset button after invalid input
    Given the webpage "Height Convertor" is loaded
    And the user enters "-50" into the height input field with data-testid "height-input"
    And the user selects "Miles" from the first option select with data-testid "first-option-select"
    And the user selects "Centimeters" from the second option select with data-testid "second-option-select"
    When the user clicks the reset button with data-testid "reset-button"
    Then the height input field with data-testid "height-input" should be empty
    And the output row with data-testid "output-row" should be hidden
    And the reset button with data-testid "reset-button" should be hidden
